HOME.TITLE: ZITADEL
HOME.SECURITYANDPRIVACY_DESC: Manage Your Information and Security Settings
HOME.PROTECTION_DESC: Manage your organisational guidelines. Explore some pre-packaged solutions that save you time and ensure security.
HOME.PROJECTS: Create and Manage Your Applications and Projects
HOME.PROJECTS_DESC: Authorize others to use your projects or define custom roles on eligible projects.
HOME.USERS_DESC: Monitor your role concept in real time. Take immediate action.
HOME.WELCOMESENTENCE: Here you can find recommended actions based on your last acquired permissions. Note that you may have to select your organisation in the header above.
HOME.DISCLAIMER: You can only see settings of your current organisation specified in the header. ZITADEL treats your data confidentially and securely.

MENU.IAMADMIN: You are an IAM Administrator. Note that you have extended permissions.

TOOLTIP.PERSONAL: Show your Personal Account, your IDPs, Login methods, Factors and Authorisations
TOOLTIP.IAM: Show ZITADELs global access policies, clear views and failed events
TOOLTIP.ORG: Show your organisations access policies, and manage your domain names
TOOLTIP.GRANTEDPROJECTS: Show projects your organisation was granted access
TOOLTIP.HUMANUSERS: Show all registered human users on your organisation
TOOLTIP.MACHINEUSERS: Show service users of your organisation
TOOLTIP.AUTHZ: Show authorizations available to your organisation users

TOKENINVALID.TITLE: Your authorization token has expired.
TOKENINVALID.DESCRIPTION: Click the button below to log in again.

USER.TITLE: Personal Information
USER.DESCRIPTION: Manage your information and security settings.

PAGES.TITLE: User
PAGES.DESCRIPTION: Create new users in your organisation and manage existing ones.
PAGES.DESCRIPTIONMACHINE: Create and manage Service Users of your organisation

DIALOG.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to permanently delete a user. Are you sure?

SENDEMAILDIALOG.TITLE: Send Email Notification
SENDEMAILDIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Click the button below to send a notification to the current email address or change the email address in the field.

MFA.TITLE: Multifactor Authentication
MFA.DESCRIPTION: Add a second factor to ensure optimal security for your account.
MFA.MANAGE_DESCRIPTION: Manage the second factor methods of your users.
MFA.OTP_DIALOG_DESCRIPTION: Scan the QR code with an authenticator app and enter the code below to verify and activate the OTP method.

DIALOG.OTP_DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete OTP as second factor. Are you sure?

DIALOG.REMOVE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an Identity Provider from a user. Do you really want to continue?

CODEDIALOG.TITLE: Verify Phone Number
CODEDIALOG.DESCRIPTION: Enter the code you recieved by text message to verify your phone number.

MACHINE.TITLE: Service User Details
MACHINE.NAME: Name
MACHINE.KEYSDESC: Define your keys and add an optional expiration date.

ADD.TITLE: Add Key
ADD.DESCRIPTION: Select your key type and choose an optional expiration date.

ADDED.TITLE: The key was created
ADDED.DESCRIPTION: Download the key as it won't be visible after closing this dialog!

PASSWORD.TITLE: Password
PASSWORD.DESCRIPTION: Enter the new password according to the policy below.
PASSWORD.MINLENGTHERROR: The password has to be at least {{value}} characters long.
PASSWORD.NOTEQUAL: The passwords provided do not match.

LOGINMETHODS.TITLE: Contact Information
LOGINMETHODS.DESCRIPTION: The provided information is used to send important information, like password reset e-mails to you.

EMAIL.TITLE: E-mail
EMAIL.EDITDESC: Enter the new email in the field below.

PHONE.TITLE: Phone
PHONE.EDITDESC: Enter the new phonenumber in the field below.
PHONE.DELETEDESC: Do you really want to delete the phonenumber

GRANTS.TITLE: User Grants
GRANTS.DESCRIPTION: Grant this user access to certain projects

CREATE.TITLE: Create User Grant
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Search for the organisation, the project and the corresponding project roles.

VALIDATION.INVALIDPATTERN: The password does not fulfil the defined rules.
VALIDATION.NOTANEMAIL: The given value is not an e-mail address
VALIDATION.MINLENGTH: The password has to be at least {{requiredLength}} characters long.
VALIDATION.NOEMAIL: The user name cannot be an e-mail address.
VALIDATION.UPPERCASEMISSING: The password must include an uppercase character.
VALIDATION.LOWERCASEMISSING: The password must include a lowercase character.
VALIDATION.SYMBOLERROR: The password must include a symbol or punctuation mark.
VALIDATION.NUMBERERROR: The password must include a digit.

TARGET.SELF: If you want to grant a user of an other organisation access
TARGET.EXTERNAL: To grant a user of your organisation access

USER.SIGNEDOUT: You are signed out. Click the button "Sign In" to sign in again.

MEMBERSHIPS.TITLE: ZITADEL Manager Roles
MEMBERSHIPS.DESCRIPTION: These are all member grants of the user. You can modify them also on organisation, project, or IAM detail pages.

MEMBER.TITLE: Managers
MEMBER.DESCRIPTION: Managers can add and edit organisations and make changes to their corresponding projects and applications.

VIEWS.TITLE: Views
VIEWS.DESCRIPTION: This card shows your ZITADEL views.

DIALOG.VIEW_CLEAR_DESCRIPTION: You are about to clear a view. Clearing a view creates a process during which data is possibly not available for endusers. Are you really sure?

FAILEDEVENTS.TITLE: Failed Events
FAILEDEVENTS.DESCRIPTION: This card shows your failed events.

PAGES.NAME: Name
PAGES.ORGDETAIL_TITLE: Enter the name and domain of your new organisation.
PAGES.ORGDETAIL_TITLE_WITHOUT_DOMAIN: Enter the name of your new organisation.

ORGDOMAIN.TITLE: Organisation Domain Ownership Verification
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION: Verify the ownership of your domain. You need to download a verification file and upload it at the provided URL listed below, or place a TXT Record DNS entry for the provided URL. To complete, click the button to verify.
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_SKIP: You can skip verification for now and continue to create your organisation, but in order to use your organisation this step has to be completed!
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_VALIDATION_DESC: The tokens are checked regularly to ensure you are still owner of the domain.
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_NEWTOKEN_DESC: If you want to request a new token, select you preferred method. If you want to validate a persisting token, click the button above.
ORGDOMAIN.VERIFICATION_VALIDATION_ONGOING: A verification token has already been requested. Click on the button to trigger a verification check.

DOMAINS.TITLE: Domains
DOMAINS.DESCRIPTION: Configure your domains. This domain can be used to log in with your users.

DELETE.TITLE: Delete Domain
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete one of your domains. Note that your users can no longer use this domain for their login.

ADD.TITLE: Add Domain
ADD.DESCRIPTION: You are about to add a domain for your organisation. After successful process, you users will be able to use the domain for their login.

MEMBER.TITLE: Organisation Managers
MEMBER.DESCRIPTION: Define the users who can change your organisations preferences.

POLICY.TITLE: Explore Policies
POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Pre-packaged policies that enhance your security.

PWD_COMPLEXITY.TITLE: Password Complexity
PWD_COMPLEXITY.DESCRIPTION: Ensures that all set passwords correspond to a specific pattern
PWD_COMPLEXITY.SYMBOLANDNUMBERERROR: The password must consist of a digit and a symbol/punctuation mark.
PWD_COMPLEXITY.SYMBOLERROR: The password must include a symbol/punctuation mark.
PWD_COMPLEXITY.NUMBERERROR: The password must include a digit.
PWD_COMPLEXITY.PATTERNERROR: The password does not meet the required pattern.

PWD_AGE.TITLE: Password Aging
PWD_AGE.DESCRIPTION: You can set a policy for the aging of passwords. This policy emits a warning after the specific aging time has elapsed.

PWD_LOCKOUT.TITLE: Password Lockout
PWD_LOCKOUT.DESCRIPTION: Password retries are infinite in default mode. You have to apply this policy if you want to show the number of retries, or set a maximum number of retries after which the account will be blocked.

IAM_POLICY.TITLE: IAM Access Preferences
IAM_POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Define access properties of your users.

LOGIN_POLICY.TITLE: Login Policy
LOGIN_POLICY.DESCRIPTION: Define how Users can be authenticated
LOGIN_POLICY.DESCRIPTIONCREATEADMIN: Users can choose from the available identity providers below.
LOGIN_POLICY.DESCRIPTIONCREATEMGMT: Users can choose from the available identity providers below. Note: You can use System-set providers as well as providers set for your organisation only.

LABEL.TITLE: Email Labelling Settings
LABEL.DESCRIPTION: Change the look of your emails.

POLICY.DEFAULTLABEL: The currently set guideline corresponds to the standard setting set by the IAM Administrator.

DATA.ALLOWUSERNAMEPASSWORD_DESC: The conventional login with user name and password is allowed.
DATA.ALLOWEXTERNALIDP_DESC: The login is allowed for the underlying identity providers
DATA.ALLOWREGISTER_DESC: If the option is selected, an additional step for registering a user appears in the login.

ORG_DETAIL.TITLE: Organisation
ORG_DETAIL.DESCRIPTION: Here you can edit the configuration of your organisation and manage the members.

MEMBER.TITLE: Members
MEMBER.ADDDESCRIPTION: Enter the e-mail addresses of the users to be added.

PAGES.TITLE: Project
PAGES.DESCRIPTION: Here you can define applications, manage roles and grant other organisations to use your project.
PAGES.LISTDESCRIPTION: Here you can find all projects you are allowed to view or perform actions on. If you can't find a project, contact a project owner or someone with the corresponding rights to gain project access.
PAGES.ZITADELPROJECT: This belongs to the ZITADEL project. Beware: If you make changes ZITADEL may not behave as intended.

REACTIVATE.TITLE: Reactivate Project
REACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to ractivate your project?

DEACTIVATE.TITLE: Deactivate Project
DEACTIVATE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to deactivate your project?

DELETE.TITLE: Delete Project
DELETE.DESCRIPTION: Do you really want to delete your project?

MEMBER.TITLE: Managers
MEMBER.TITLEDESC: Managers can make changes to this project based on their role.
MEMBER.DESCRIPTION: Here you can find all managers of this project. You can add a new member and manage existing ones.

GRANT.TITLE: Granted Organisations
GRANT.DESCRIPTION: Allow an other organisation to use your project.

CREATE.TITLE: Create Organisation Grant
CREATE.SEL_USERS: Select the users you wish to grant access
CREATE.SEL_ROLES: Select the roles you want to be added to the grant
CREATE.SEL_ORG_DESC: Enter the complete domain to specify the organisation to grant.
CREATE.ORG_DESCRIPTION: You are about to grant a user for the organisation {{name}}.
CREATE.ORG_DESCRIPTION_DESC: Switch the context in the header above to grant a user for another organisation.

DETAIL.TITLE: Managers of the Granted Organisation
DETAIL.DESC: These are the managers of the granted organisation. You can select which users are allowed to maintain control of the project.
DETAIL.MEMBERDESC: These are the managers of the granted organisation. Add users here who should gain access to edit the data of the project.

ROLE.EMPTY: No role has been created yet.
ROLE.TITLE: Roles
ROLE.DESCRIPTION: Define some roles which can be used to create project-grants.
ROLE.NAME: Name
ROLE.ADDDESCRIPTION: Enter the data for the new role.
ROLE.EDITDESCRIPTION: Enter the new data for the role.
ROLE.SELECTGROUPTOOLTIP: Select all Roles of the group {{group}}.
ROLE.ASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: Roleinformation is sent as Token, Userinfo endpoint or other type, depending on your application settings.
ROLE.CHECK_DESCRIPTION: If set, users are only allowed to authenticate if any role is assigned to their account.

LIST.TITLE: Identity Providers
LIST.DESCRIPTION: Define additional Identity Providers, which can be used to authenticate in your organisations.

CREATE.TITLE: New Identity Provider
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Configure the Endpoint of your new service provider.

DETAIL.TITLE: Identity Provider
DETAIL.DESCRIPTION: General Configuration of your identity provider.

OIDC.TITLE: OIDC Configuration
OIDC.DESCRIPTION: Provide the correct OIDC Configuration for your identity Provider below!

IDP.NAME: Name
IDP.DELETE_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an identity provider. The resulting changes are irrevocable. Do you really want to do this?
IDP.DELETE_SELECTION_DESCRIPTION: You are about to delete an identity provider. The resulting changes are irrevocable. Do you really want to do this?

CREATE.TITLE: Login Policy
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Define how your users can be authenticated on your organisation.

ADDIDP.TITLE: Add Identity Provider
ADDIDP.DESCRIPTION: You can select predefined or selfcreated providers for authentication.

PAGES.TITLE: Application
PAGES.DESCRIPTION: Here you can edit your application data and it's configuration.
PAGES.CREATE_OIDC_DESC_TITLE: Enter Your Application Details Step by Step
PAGES.CREATE_OIDC_DESC_SUB: A recommended configuration will be automatically generated.

OIDC.PROSWITCH: I'm a pro. Skip this wizard.
OIDC.TYPETITLE: What type of application do you want to create?
OIDC.REDIRECTTITLE: Specify the URIs where the login will redirect to.
OIDC.POSTREDIRECTTITLE: This is the redirect URI after logout.
OIDC.REDIRECTDESCRIPTIONWEB: Redirect URIs must begin with https://. http:// is only valid with enabled development mode.
OIDC.REDIRECTDESCRIPTIONNATIVE: Redirect URIs must begin with your own protocol or http://localhost.
OIDC.REDIRECTNOTVALID: This redirect URI is not valid.
OIDC.TITLE: OIDC Configuration
OIDC.CLIENTSECRET_DESCRIPTION: Keep your client secret at a safe place as it will disappear once the dialog is closed.
OIDC.DEVMODEDESC: Beware: With development mode enabled redirect URIs will not be validated.
OIDC.GRANTTITLE: Select your grant types. Note: Implicit is only available for browser-based applications.
OIDC.UNSECUREREDIRECT: I sure hope you know what you are doing.
OIDC.OVERVIEWTITLE: You are now done. Review your configuration.
OIDC.ACCESSTOKENROLEASSERTION: Add user roles to the access token
OIDC.ACCESSTOKENROLEASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: If selected, the roles of the authenticated user are added to the access token.
OIDC.IDTOKENROLEASSERTION: Add user roles to the id token
OIDC.IDTOKENROLEASSERTION_DESCRIPTION: If selected, the roles of the authenticated user are added to the id token.

GRANTS.TITLE: Authorizations
GRANTS.DESC: Here you can manage authorizations of your organization users.

PROJECT.TITLE: Authorization
PROJECT.DESCRIPTION: Define authorizations for the specified project. Note that you can only see entries of projects and users for which you have the permissions.

USER.TITLE: Authorization
USER.DESCRIPTION: Define authorizations for the specified user. Note that you can only see entries of projects and users for which you have the permissions.

CREATE.TITLE: Create authorization
CREATE.DESCRIPTION: Search for the orgnanisation, the project, and the corresponding roles.

DETAIL.TITLE: Authorization Detail
DETAIL.DESCRIPTION: Here you can see all the details of the authorization.

CHANGES.BOTTOM: You've reached the end of the list.

ORG.TITLE: Activity
ORG.DESCRIPTION: Here you can see the latest events that have generated an organisation change.

PROJECT.TITLE: Activity
PROJECT.DESCRIPTION: Here you can see the latest events that have generated a project change.

USER.TITLE: Activity
USER.DESCRIPTION: Here you can see the latest events that have generated a user change.
